page.title: 02Views on Darwen - a Survey
page.content: Over half the interviewees had lived in Darwen for more than fifteen years and of the remainder,most felt that Darwen was a better place than their previous towns. People were equally divided between those who felt that the enviroment (parks,leisure facilities etc.)were adequate, and those who saw a need for improvement. The great majority criticized shopping facilities in the town, and it was felt that inadequate provision was being made for the needs of children. Although two thirds of those interviewed belong to a church, very few take part in any neighbourhood activities.Financially Darweners are thought to be comfortable with few being poor.It is seen as a small friendly town near to the country.
